alert.note: Alert for Mason (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued November 05 at 3:55PM PST until November 06 at 2:00AM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Skokomish River At Potlatch affecting Mason County. .Heavy rain yesterday pushed the Skokomish River above flood stage. The river has since dropped below minor flood stage but additional periods of moderate rainfall may push the river near to just above minor flood stage again through tonight. For the Olympic Peninsula Region...including Potlatch...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Skokomish River at Potlatch. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.5 feet, the Skokomish River will cause widespread flooding of pasture lands, with water flowing quickly over West Bourgault Road and Skokomish Valley Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM PDT the stage was 16.3 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 6:30 AM Sunday was was 17.6 feet. - Forecast...River level may rise into tonight with additional rainfall into Monday keeping near minor flood stage. - Flood stage is 16.5 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 200 AM PST.
